catalogue_raissonne: Bartsch 260 (vol. 8, p. 441); New Hollstein 260; Zschelletzschky, pp. 190-91
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: floral and leaf decorative pattern with two Tritons at center, emerging from vines; one Triton faces out, the other with its back to viewer; two putti holding fronds flank L and R side
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, bottom center: [1537 / AG]
text: Heinrich Aldegrever showed his reverence for Albrecht Dürer by imitating his monogram style. He also used the great German artist’s prints as his personal model book. The half-fish triton at left has the same pouty face as Diana in Dürer’s Apollo and Diana (c. 1505), and the long-waisted bodies are typical of Dürer, too. This panel was probably intended to inspire furniture decoration.
title: Ornamental Design with Tendrils, a Couple of Tritons, and Two Children
